field.label: Listen IPs
field.help: Listener IP address of relay server. Multiple listeners can be specified. Use 0.0.0.0 or :: to listen on all IPv4 or IPv6 addresses respectively.

field.label: Listen Port
field.help: TURN listener port for UDP and TCP (Default: 3478). NOTE: Do NOT set this to 80 or 443 when listening on all IPs, this may block access to the OPNsense WebUI.

field.label: Min UDP Port
field.help: Lower bound of the UDP relay endpoints (Default: 49152).

field.label: Max UDP Port
field.help: Upper bound of the UDP relay endpoints (Default: 65535).

field.label: Enable TLS
field.help: Enable TLS/DTLS support. This requires a valid TLS certificate.

field.label: TLS Port
field.help: TURN listener port for TLS (Default: 5349). NOTE: Do NOT set this to 80 or 443 when listening on all IPs, this may block access to the OPNsense WebUI.

field.label: Use Auth Secret
field.help: This sets a special authorization option that is based upon authentication secret. Enables TURN REST API.

field.label: Auth Secret
field.help: The authentication secret value for TURN REST API. It is recommended to use a long random string, at least 32 characters long.

field.label: Realm
field.help: The default realm to be used for the users. Must be used with TURN REST API. A good choice may be the domain name of the company.

field.label: Enable Fingerprints
field.help: Use fingerprints in the TURN messages.

field.label: User Quota
field.help: Per-user allocation quota. Default value is 0 (no quota, unlimited number of sessions per user).

field.label: Total Quota
field.help: Total allocation quota. Default value is 0 (no quota).

field.label: Stale Nonce Lifetime
field.help: Limit the nonce lifetime (in seconds) for extra security. Default value is 600 secs (10 minutes).

field.label: Channel Lifetime
field.help: The lifetime for the channel (in seconds). Default value is 600 secs (10 minutes). MUST NOT be changed, because this would violate RFC 5766.

field.label: Permission Lifetime
field.help: The permission lifetime (in seconds). Default value is 300 secs (5 minutes). MUST NOT be changed, because this would violate RFC 5766.
